text:
From: Paul and Timothy, servants of the Messiah Jesus.
To: All the holy ones in Philippi, along with their overseers and ministers, who are in union with the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: May grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be yours!
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank my God every time I remember you,
speaker: Narrator

text: always praying joyfully in every one of my prayers for all of you
speaker: Narrator

text: because of your partnership in the gospel from the first day until now.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am convinced of this, that the one who began a good action among you will bring it to completion by the Day of the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is only right for me to think this way about all of you, because you’re constantly on my mind. Both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, all of you are partners with me in this privilege.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my witness how much I long for all of you with the compassion that the Messiah Jesus provides.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is my prayer, that your love will keep on growing more and more with full knowledge and insight,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may be able to choose what is best and be pure and blameless until the day when the Messiah returns,
speaker: Narrator

text: having been filled with the fruit of righteousness that comes through Jesus the Messiah so that God will be glorified and praised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I want you to know, brothers, that what has happened to me has actually caused the gospel to advance.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, it has become clear to the whole imperial guard and to everyone else that I am in prison for preaching about the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, because of my imprisonment the Lord has caused most of the brothers to become confident to speak God’s word more boldly and courageously than ever before.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some are preaching the Messiah because of jealousy and dissension, while others do so because of their good will.
speaker: Narrator

text: The latter are motivated by love, because they know that I have been appointed to defend the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The former proclaim the Messiah because they are selfishly ambitious and insincere, thinking that they will stir up trouble for me during my imprisonment.
speaker: Narrator

text: But so what? Just this—that in every way, whether by false or true motives, the Messiah is being proclaimed. Because of this, I rejoice and will continue to rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that this will result in my deliverance through your prayers and the help that comes from the Spirit of Jesus the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I rejoice because I eagerly expect and hope that I will have nothing to be ashamed of, because through my boldness the Messiah will be exalted through me, now as always, whether I live or die.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to me, to go on living is the Messiah, and to die is gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if I continue living, fruitful labor is the result, so I do not know which I would prefer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, I cannot decide between the two. I have the desire to leave this life and be with the Messiah, for that is far better.
speaker: Narrator

text: But for your sake it is better that I remain alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since I am convinced of this, I know that I will continue to live and be with all of you, so you will mature in the faith and know joy in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then your rejoicing in the Messiah Jesus will increase along with mine when I visit with you again.
speaker: Narrator

text: The only thing that matters is that you continue to live as good citizens in a manner worthy of the gospel of the Messiah. Then, whether I come to see you or whether I stay away, I may hear all about you—that you are standing firm in one spirit, struggling with one mind for the faith of the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that you are not intimidated by your opponents in any way. This is evidence that they will be destroyed and that you will be saved—and all because of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have been given the privilege for the Messiah’s sake not only to believe in him but also to suffer for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have the same struggle that you saw in me and now hear that I am still having.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, if there is any encouragement in the Messiah, if there is any comfort of love, if there is any fellowship in the Spirit, if there is any compassion and sympathy,
speaker: Narrator

text: then fill me with joy by having the same attitude, sharing the same love, being united in spirit, and keeping one purpose in mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not act out of selfish ambition or conceit, but with humility think of others as being better than yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be concerned about your own interests, but also be concerned about the interests of others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have the same attitude among yourselves that was also in the Messiah Jesus:
speaker: Narrator

text:
In God’s own form existed he,
    and shared with God equality,
        deemed nothing needed grasping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead, poured out in emptiness,
    a servant’s form did he possess,
        a mortal man becoming.
In human form he chose to be,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and lived in all humility,
        death on a cross obeying.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now lifted up by God to heaven,
    a name above all others given,
        this matchless name possessing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And so, when Jesus’ name is called,
    the knees of everyone should fall,
        wherever they’re residing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then every tongue in one accord,
    will say that Jesus the Messiah is Lord,
        while God the Father praising.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so, my dear friends, just as you have always obeyed, not only when I was with you but even more now that I am absent, continue to work out your salvation with fear and trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is God who is producing in you both the desire and the ability to do what pleases him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do everything without complaining or arguing
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may be blameless and innocent, God’s children without any faults among a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you shine like stars in the world
speaker: Narrator

text: as you hold firmly to the word of life. Then I will be proud when the Messiah returns that I did not run in vain or work hard in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet even if I am being poured out like an offering as part of the sacrifice and service I offer for your faith, I rejoice, and I share my joy with all of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, you also should rejoice and share your joy with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon so that I can be encouraged when I learn of your condition.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not have anyone else like him who takes a genuine interest in your welfare.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the others look after their own interests, not after those of Jesus the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you know his proven worth—how like a son with his father he served with me in the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I hope to send him as soon as I see how things are going to turn out for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, I am confident in the Lord that I will come to visit you soon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, I thought it best to send Epaphroditus—my brother, fellow worker, and fellow soldier, but your messenger and minister to my need—back to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has been longing for all of you and is troubled because you heard that he was sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, he was sick to the point of death, but God had mercy on him, and not only on him but also on me, so that I would not have one sorrow on top of another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I am especially eager to send him so that you may have the joy of seeing him again, and so that I may feel relieved.
speaker: Narrator

text: So joyfully welcome him in the Lord and make sure you honor such people highly,
speaker: Narrator

text: because he came close to death for the work of the Messiah by risking his life to complete what remained unfinished in your service to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, my brothers, keep on rejoicing in the Lord. It is no trouble for me to write the same things to you; indeed, it is for your safety.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware of the dogs! Beware of the evil workers! Beware of the mutilators!
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is we who are the circumcision—we who worship in the Spirit of God and find our joy in the Messiah Jesus. We have not placed any confidence in the flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: although I could have confidence in the flesh. If anyone thinks he can place confidence in the flesh, I have more reason to think so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having been circumcised on the eighth day, I am of the nation of Israel, from the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of Hebrews. As far as the Law is concerned, I was a Pharisee.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for my zeal, I was a persecutor of the church. As far as righteousness in the Law is concerned, I was blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whatever things were assets to me, these I now consider a loss for the sake of the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: What is more, I continue to consider all these things to be a loss for the sake of what is far more valuable, knowing the Messiah Jesus, my Lord. It is because of him that I have experienced the loss of all those things. Indeed, I consider them rubbish in order to gain the Messiah
speaker: Narrator

text: and be found in him, not having a righteousness of my own that comes from the Law, but one that comes through the faithfulness of the Messiah, the righteousness that comes from God and that depends on faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: I want to know the Messiah—what his resurrection power is like and what it means to share in his sufferings by becoming like him in his death,
speaker: Narrator

text: though I hope to experience the resurrection from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: It’s not that I have already reached this goal or have already become perfect. But I keep pursuing it, hoping somehow to embrace it just as I have been embraced by the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, I do not consider myself to have embraced it yet. But this one thing I do: Forgetting what lies behind and straining forward to what lies ahead,
speaker: Narrator

text: I keep pursuing the goal to win the prize of God’s heavenly call in the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, those of us who are mature should think this way. And if you think differently about anything, God will show you how to think.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, we should live up to what we have achieved so far.
speaker: Narrator

text: Join together in imitating me, brothers, and pay close attention to those who live by the example we have set for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have often told you, and now tell you even with tears, that many live as enemies of the cross of the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their destiny is destruction, their god is their belly, and their glory is in their shame. Their minds are set on worldly things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our citizenship, however, is in heaven, and it is from there that we eagerly wait for a Savior, the Lord Jesus, the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will change our unassuming bodies and make them like his glorious body through the power that enables him to bring everything under his authority.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, my dear brothers whom I long for, my joy and my victor’s crown, this is how you must stand firm in the Lord, dear friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: I urge Euodia and Syntyche to have the same attitude in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, I also ask you, my true partner, to help these women. They have worked hard with me to advance the gospel, along with Clement and the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the Book of Life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep on rejoicing in the Lord at all times. I will say it again: Keep on rejoicing!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your gracious attitude be known to all people. The Lord is near:
speaker: Narrator

text: Never worry about anything. Instead, in every situation let your petitions be made known to God through prayers and requests, with thanksgiving.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God’s peace, which goes far beyond anything we can imagine, will guard your hearts and minds in union with the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brothers, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is fair, whatever is pure, whatever is acceptable, whatever is commendable, if there is anything of excellence and if there is anything praiseworthy—keep thinking about these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise, keep practicing these things: what you have learned, received, heard, and seen in me. Then the God of peace will be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I rejoice in the Lord greatly, because once again you have shown your concern for me. Of course, you were concerned for me but you did not have an opportunity to show it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not saying this because I am in any need, for I have learned to be content in whatever situation I am in.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know how to be humble, and I know how to prosper. In each and every situation I have learned the secret of being full and of going hungry, of having too much and of having too little.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, it was kind of you to share my troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: You Philippians also know that in the early days of the gospel, when I left Macedonia, no church participated with me in the matter of giving and receiving except for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even while I was in Thessalonica, you provided for my needs not once, but twice.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not that I am looking for a gift. No, I want to see that you receive the fruit that increases to your benefit.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been paid in full and have more than enough. I am fully supplied, now that I have received from Epaphroditus what you sent—a fragrant aroma, a sacrifice acceptable and pleasing to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my God will fully supply your every need according to his glorious riches in the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glory belongs to our God and Father forever and ever! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet every saint who is in union with the Messiah Jesus. The brothers who are with me send their greetings to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the saints, especially those of the emperor’s household, greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the grace of the Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be with your spirit! Amen.
speaker: Narrator
